Title: Effects of clopidogrel in addition to aspirin in patients with acute coronary syndromes without ST-segment elevation
Population: Patients presenting to hospital within 24 hours after onset of symptoms and did not have ST elevation
Drug.dose: 300mg loading dose followed by 75mg once daily
Duration of medication: 3 to 12 months (mean duration of treatment, 9 months)
Outcome: death from cardiovascular causes, non-fatal MI or stroke

Title: Addition of clopidogrel to aspirin in 45,852 patients with acute myocardial infarction: randomised placebo-controlled trial.
Population: Patients admitted within 24 hours of suspected acute MI onset with ST elevation, left-bundle branch block, or ST depression.

Title: Addition of clopidogrel to aspirin and fibrinolytic therapy for myocardial infarction with ST-segment elevation.
Population: Patients 18 to 75 years of age presenting within 12 hours after onset of STEMI
Drug.dose: 300mg loading dose followed by 75mg once daily
Duration of medication: Up to day of Coronary Angiography, day 8 or hospital discahrge, whichever came first
Outcome: TIMI grade 0 or 1 on angiography, death, recurrent MI

Title: Prasugrel versus clopidogrel in patients with acute coronary syndromes.
Population: Patients with acute coronary syndrome with scheduled PCI
Drug.dose: 60mg loading dose followed by 10mg once daily
Duration of medication: 6 to 15 months (median duration of treatment, 14.5 months)
Outcome: death from cardiovascular causes, non-fatal MI or non-fatal stroke

Title: Ticagrelor versus clopidogrel in patients with acute coronary syndromes.
Population: Patients hospitalized for an acute coronary syndrome with an onset of symptoms during previous 24 hours
Drug.dose: 180mg loading dose followed by 90mg twice daily
Outcome: death from vascular causes, MI, stroke

Title: Prasugrel versus clopidogrel for acute coronary syndromes without revascularization.
Population: Patients under the age of 75 with NSTEMI or Unstable angina with final treatment strategy of medical management
Drug.dose: 30mg loading dose followed by 10mg once daily
Outcome: death from cardiovascular causes, MI, stroke

Title: Clopidogrel with Aspirin in Acute Minor Stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack
Population: patients within 24 hours after the onset of minor ischemic stroke or high-risk TIA
Outcome: stroke, MI or death from cardiovascular causes

Title: Effects of Clopidogrel Added to Aspirin in Patients with Recent Lacunar Stroke
Population: recent symptomatic lacunar infarcts identified by magnetic resonance imaging.
Outcome: stroke recurrence (any ischemic stroke or intracranial hemorrhage, including subdural hematomas)
